In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is a way to do this in Julia using DataFrames.jl package. 

First, make sure you have installed the required packages. If not, run the following commands in your Julia console:
```julia
using Pkg
Pkg.add("DataFrames")
```
Then you can define and use the function `add_yearmonth` as follows:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyyMM") |> Vector{Int}
end
```
You can call this function like this: 
```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` to your DataFrame, where each element is the year and month (in the format "yyyymm") of corresponding `dt`.
  
Please note that you need to replace `df` with your actual DataFrame variable. 

If you encounter any issues or errors during this process, please make sure you have Julia installed and working properly in your system. If not, download it from https://julialang.org/downloads/.
